pages.text:
Collophane Chickens are a species of phosphate mineral chickens. Often mistaken for other minerals, which is how Apatite got its name from the greek word απατείν.
Lay Item: Apatite!$(br2)Apatite was sometimes used as a gemstone. Sadly, you don't know any way of using it other than as a source of phosphor for fertilizer.
